alert.note: Alert for Clearfield (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL CLEARFIELD COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northwest of Tyrone, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Osceola Mills, Chester Hill, Houtzdale, South Philipsburg, Jeffries, Irvona, Coalport, Ramey, Brisbin and Glen Hope. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Pennsylvania.
